responses: UM shuttles buses operate from 7:30 AM to 10:00 PM. There are 25-26 trips per day depending on the bus route. You can check the schedule for each bus route for more information by asking " What is the schedule for bus {route name}?".

The UM shuttle service runs between 7:30 AM and 10:00 PM, offering 25 to 26 journeys daily, varying by the specific bus route. For detailed timings of each route, inquire with "What is the schedule for bus {route name}?" for precise information.

The shuttle buses operate from 7:30 AM to 10:00 PM, with 25-26 trips per day depending on the bus route. You can find the schedule for each bus route by asking "What is the schedule for bus {route name}?".

University of Malaya shuttle bus eligibility
Are University of Malaya students allowed to use the shuttle bus service?
Are University of Malaya staff members allowed to use the shuttle bus service?
Are University of Malaya lecturers allowed to use the shuttle bus service?

Who is allowed to use the shuttle buses?
I am a University of Malaya student, can I use the shuttle bus service?
I am a University of Malaya staff member, can I use the shuttle bus service?
I am a University of Malaya lecturer, can I use the shuttle bus service?
responses: The bus permit issued by the Land Public Transport Agency of Malaysia is for the use of UM students (not including UM foundation students - PASUM) and staff only.

The bus permit provided by Malaysia's Land Public Transport Agency is exclusively for the transportation of University of Malaya students, excluding those enrolled in the foundation program (PASUM), and university staff.

University of Malaya student card
University of Malaya student ID
UM student card
UM student ID
I am a University of Malaya student, do I need to show my student card to take the shuttle bus?
I am a University of Malaya student, do I need to show my student ID to take the shuttle bus?
I am a UM student, do I need to show my student card to take the shuttle bus?
I am a UM student, do I need to show my student ID to take the shuttle bus?
responses: The shuttle bus service is free for UM students and staff. You need either a UM student card or an offer letter for those who have not yet obtained a UM student card.

The University of Malaya provides a complimentary shuttle bus service for its students and staff members. To access this service, individuals are required to present a valid University of Malaya student identification card. In the case of new students who have not yet received their student ID card, a copy of the offer letter will suffice.

The University of Malaya offers a free shuttle bus service for both students and staff. To use this service, one must show a valid University of Malaya student ID card. However, new students awaiting their student ID card can use their offer letter as a temporary proof of identification to access the shuttle service.

responses:
Guidelines for using the UM shuttle bus service:
- Must show UM student card to the bus driver.
- Only UM students and staff can use the shuttle bus service.
- Must queue when boarding and alighting the bus

To utilize the University of Malaya's shuttle bus service, it is mandatory for passengers to present their UM student identification card upon entering the bus. This service is exclusively available to the university's students and staff members. Additionally, it is required to form an orderly line while getting on and off the bus to ensure a smooth and efficient transportation experience for all.
